The Monetary Policy Committee (M-P-C) held its meeting on seventh august two thousand and twenty four and decided to keep the repo rate at six point five percent. What does this mean for your investment portfolio, especially if you're betting on stocks?

unnormalised: Well, higher interest rates generally make borrowing more expensive. This can slow down economic growth, which in turn could affect company profits. So, some analysts are saying to be cautious. Don't go all in, bhai! Consider diversifying instead of putting everything in just one or two stocks. Think about mutual funds or ETFs – you know, the safe route. Experts at ICICI Direct are suggesting a balanced approach.
